security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation with persona descriptions, testing scenarios, and report templates. No executable code, no network calls, no filesystem access beyond reading its own file. Zero attack surface.

content.user_title: Test LogiDocs features from customer perspectives
content.value_statement: Teams need to validate software features from real customer viewpoints before release. This skill provides structured persona-based testing using two distinct customer profiles to identify UX issues, friction points, and missing features early.
actual_capabilities: Test features from two distinct customer personas (Aftrac end user and Sirius consultant)
Generate simulated customer feedback with realistic expectations and pain points
Review UI and UX from different user expertise levels and use cases
Create structured persona testing reports with actionable recommendations
Evaluate features against specific compliance workflows (CE/UKCA marking and ISO standards)
Identify friction points before actual customer feedback arrives
limitations: Only provides testing methodology and persona context for LogiDocs Certify
Does not execute actual browser automation or user testing
Cannot access real customer data or actual user sessions
Limited to predefined persona scenarios listed in the skill documentation

use_cases.title: Validate features before release
use_cases.description: Test new features from customer perspectives to catch issues before they reach real users.

use_cases.title: Review interface from user views
use_cases.description: Evaluate how different customer types navigate features and where confusion occurs.

use_cases.title: Supplement automated testing
use_cases.description: Add persona-based feedback to testing cycles for comprehensive coverage.

prompt_templates.title: Basic feature review
prompt_templates.prompt: Test the [feature name] page from [Aftrac/Sirius] perspective. What would they notice first? What works well? Where would they struggle?

prompt_templates.title: End-to-end workflow test
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the [workflow name] from [Aftrac/Sirius] perspective. Walk through each step as this persona. Identify where they would get confused or frustrated.

prompt_templates.title: Feedback simulation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate feedback [Aftrac/Sirius] would give after using [specific feature] for 20 minutes. Include what they like, what confuses them, and what they wish existed.

prompt_templates.title: Comparative analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare how Aftrac and Sirius would approach [task]. What different expectations and needs does each have? How should the UI accommodate both?

output_examples.input: Test the document upload page from Aftrac's perspective.
output:
**First Impressions**
- Clear upload area is immediately visible
- Progress indicator is helpful but could be more prominent

**Positive Observations**
- Bulk upload works smoothly
- Auto-categorization saves time

**Friction Points**
- Certification expiry warnings are hidden in submenu
- Missing guidance for first-time upload

**In Character Quote**
> 'I just want to upload my supplier certs and know what to do next. The upload is fine but I'm not sure what happens after.'

best_practices: Define clear testing objectives before invoking persona testing
Use both personas (Aftrac and Sirius) to capture different user needs
Document friction points with specific page locations and user actions
Generate quotes in character to capture authentic customer voice
anti_patterns: Using only one persona when both perspectives add value
Skipping the structured report format after testing
Testing without a specific feature or workflow in mind
Treating persona testing as a replacement for real user feedback

faq.question: Which persona should I choose first?
faq.answer: Start with Aftrac for basic functionality, then Sirius for advanced features. Both reveal different issues.

faq.question: Can this skill automate browser testing?
faq.answer: No, this is a methodology skill for structured persona-based review, not an automation tool.

faq.question: What makes the two personas different?
faq.answer: Aftrac is an end user with limited compliance expertise. Sirius is a consultant with deep ISO knowledge.

faq.question: How detailed are the reports?
faq.answer: Reports include first impressions, positives, friction points, missing features, and in-character quotes.

faq.question: Can I add custom personas?
faq.answer: This skill supports only the defined Aftrac and Sirius personas. Custom personas require skill modification.

faq.question: How does this compare to real user testing?
faq.answer: Persona testing catches obvious issues early. Real user testing is still essential for final validation.
